msgs.text: *(under construction)* THE PROBLEM OF TODAY'S MONEY (AND WHY BITCOIN IS THE SOLUTION) "It is well enough that people of the nation do not understand our banking and monetary system, for if they did, I believe there would be a revolution before tomorrow morning." - Henry Ford 70% of ALL USD in circulation was created after 2008. Over 40% since 2020 It's getting worse and worse Fiat currency in the United States started about 100 years ago. Quick history of the dollar: https://stacker.news/items/3009 The dollar as defined by the Constitution is a "weight of gold or silver." In 1913, the government inserted a permanent central bank called Federal Reserve to stand in between the Constitution and the people. This was the introduction of "the Fed dollar" or fiat currency. It is not a Constitutional dollar; it is a note that is issued by the Federal Reserve. This also gave the right to the Federal Reserve to print money whenever they wanted to. *One dollar today was worth $0.04 in 1913, a reduction of purchasing power by 96%* In the years past The Great Depression, through WWII, and after, the United States traded cash for gold from citizen and other nations. Eventually, those nations started asking for their gold back. In 1971 President Nixon decided to cut off other nations from their gold and we got off the Gold Standard. This is known as "The Nixon Shock." Our money wasn't backed by gold anymore. Instead, it was backed solely by the full faith and credit of the United States government. You had to trust the government. And while it helped America grow as a superpower ‚Ä¶ and helped many of us live lives of exorbitant privilege ‚Ä¶It‚Äôs also responsible for the mess we‚Äôre in today. And it‚Äôs what will ultimately topple the US dollar. They say those who don‚Äôt know history are doomed to repeat it. But politicians know their history.

They know that inflating the money supply is what ultimately kills it. They either just can‚Äôt help themselves - or they actually want our currency to collapse. There‚Äôs no rolling this back, either. The damage is already done. The US dollar is a ‚Äòdead man walking‚Äô. And the only thing that can save America itself is bitcoin.

When our government needs money, they create bonds or treasury bills and then sell them to large banks who sell them to the Federal Reserve for a profit. This is the "Magic Money Machine." The Fed is America's central bank, but it doesn't have any money on its balance sheets. When a bank buys a bond and takes it to the Federal Reserve, the Fed says, "Thanks Mr. Banker, here's the principal and some profit." New money isn't exchanged, it simply appears on the banks accounts- magic. This has been happening in secret for 100 years. This is where it gets really interesting. The Federal Reserve is not a government agency. It's a private entity. Its shareholders are banks who earn a dividend. This process answers to no one. And the Fed also sets the bar for how much interest you pay for a car, home or business loan. 

Fractional reserve banking - means that banks only store a portion of our money while lending out way more (further debasing our money). Today, when you deposit $100 into a bank, the bank has the power to do whatever it wants with it. It can even take that $100 and loan $97 out to another person. The bank still says that you have $100...but it also says that the other person has $97 (it's all digital). Then, that person has to pay interest to the bank on that $97. The person then spends those $97 to some shop. That shop then deposits the $97 into a bank. Then the bank lends most of that money out too! This happens again and again...new money created from debt!

If you are deemed "credit worthy" by a bank, you can take out a loan where a bank creates money out of no where and charges you interest for it...giving more money to the banks!

If everyone who had money in banks requested 3% of their money in cash, the banks would not be able to do it.

2008 financial crisis: Banks loaned out too much money to people who couldn't afford to pay it back. 30 million jobs were destroyed. The US lost $16 trillion in household wealth. The banks foreclosed on over 1 million homes. Were the banks punished for their actions? No, in fact, they were bailed out!

Need to mention: Debasement by Qualitative easing (QE) and the constant printing of USD by the Federal Reserve (Fed). Negative interest rates.  The playbook is as follows: increase the money supply, reduce interest rates and reflate asset values such that existing debt levels can be sustained and more debt can be created. However, despite record low interest rates, the global economy has once again begun to deteriorate and the effectiveness of quantitative easing is naturally being questioned by many. Contrary to popular belief, the function of quantitative easing actually creates the instability it seeks to avoid. When understanding its base operation, it becomes clear that quantitative easing has always been a fool‚Äôs errand. Quantitative easing is designed to allow banks to expand credit; for every dollar that is created through quantitative easing, the credit system can expand by multiples of each dollar added. This incremental credit (think auto loans, mortgages, student loans, etc.) is then used to purchase goods in the real economy, which causes the prices of goods to rise and the value of the dollar to decline on a relative basis.

Our monetary policies have created a nation of debtors. Not just personal debt or cooperate debt, but government debt. What is the wealth of the nation? It is simply a gigantic hole of money that we owe to the world that is never going to be paid back. The US pays more than $400 billion in interest to its creditors every year. When a government spends more money than it collects in taxes, it just borrows or prints more. (see US current debt: https://www.usdebtclock.org/)

Solution: Bitcoin via properties of Thermodynamics (first and third). See explanation here: https://hackernoon.com/bitcoin-and-thermodynamics-63f46b90627

If we can fix the money, we can fix the world. For the last century, the government has had full control of our money because they control the Federal Reserve and the Federal Reserve controls the money printer. Whoever controls the money printer controls everything. Decisions that influence our cultures, the food we eat, the education we receive, the energy that we have and can use, poverty levels as well as political imbalance, greed and corruption and more is all out of our control. There is a reason why some financial institutions like Goldman Sachs are still prospering while others like the Lehman Brothers went out of business- the government decided to print money for one of them and not the other. There is a reason why some areas of the country suffer from higher levels of poverty and get less educational funding than others- can you guess why?

We need to end the printing of money. We need to take back control from the government. We need to shut down Keynesian, Marxist and Monetarist economists and other proponents of the state theory of money who believe money is whatever the state says is money, and therefore it is the prerogative of the state to do with it as it pleases, which is going to inevitably mean printing it to spend on achieving state objectives, hurting the motives of our politicians and weakening our Democracy.

We need to adopt Austrian Economics advocating for no government control over our money. As the saying goes, "Bitcoin fixes this." The Austrian theory of money posits that money emerges in a market as the most marketable commodity and most salable asset, the one asset whose holders can sell with the most ease, in favorable conditions. Bitcoin is sound money because of its fixed supply. When people store their value in Bitcoin, it will retain its purchasing power over time. Bitcoin allows everyone in the world access to a free market. There is a way out of the fiat system, and it is Bitcoin. Bitcoin is resurrecting what money used to be all about. It is money with real value.

Throughout history, money from taxes and government bonds have financed wars. Just take a look at this chart: https://discord.com/channels/874318808423219280/874319602811801670/875572406612283432

We are living in an amazing time period where three revolutionary cycles are converging. The financial market resets every 80 years. A technological revolution happens every 50 years or so. We have a political/social/cultural revolution every 250 years. It seems like every 250 years, the world rejects globalism and more centralization and moves to decentralization. The American/French resolution happed 250 years ago and 250 years before that was the Protestant Reformation. Most people are looking for a centralized answer- will the dollar remain? Will it be the Chinese Yuan? Will it be an SDR? I think the world will be decentralized with Bitcoin. The Bitcoin Standard.

Mention Bitcoin's involvement in geopolitics. If two governments of two nations don't get along, money simply doesn't flow across their boarders. To give an example of how this applies: if you wanted to give a dollar to someone via the internet, almost half of the world can't receive it from you. Bitcoin fixes this.

The function of the American Rule of Law is to preserve our rights to life, liberty, & property...which are fundamentally the rights to consume, deploy, and store energy. Bitcoin perfects property rights (stored energy) because it literally is time-bottled energy with zero path loss.

You don't have to explain Bitcoin's use case to an Argentinian, Venezuelan, Zimbabwean, Ukrainian, Cypriot, Greek or Cuban. There countries are examples where there is an ongoing monetary crisis. There currency is worth virtually nothing (believe it or not, this is where USD in the United States is headed). What gives money its value? The people do. Essentially, we are all under the hallucination that the money we have to day will be able to be used tomorrow to buy goods and services. This hallucination took hundreds of years to develop. It started in the 15th century (the Chinese did it even earlier in the 11th century) with the introduction of paper money- gold certificates, IOUs, bearer notes, etc pieces of paper which could be exchanged in promise for something else. But we've gotten to the point where these pieces of paper don't actually represent any value...not gold, not anything else...just a belief in value.

Gresham's Law: where bad money chases out good money. If you have something that holds value (good money), you stash it! You use the bad money as a means of exchange until you run out of it...but it never really runs out because everyone is using it and it remains in circulation!

When Buckminster Fuller was asked, "How would you suggest solving international problems without violence?" He answered:

"I always try to solve problems by some artifact, some tool or invention that makes what people are doing obsolete so that it makes this particular kind of problem no longer relevant.

My answer would be to develop a world energy grid, an electric grid where everybody is on the same grid. All of a sudden, there would be no problems anymore, no international troubles.

Our new economic basis wouldn't be gold or dollars; it would be kilowatt hours."

R. Buckminster Fuller

Bucky spent his life searching for what he called nature's coordinate system. He observed that nature does not have a chemistry, physics, or biology department, yet somehow, everything in the universe was coordinating. He deduced that there was an underlying system used to coordinate everything. He often referred to it as a universal time-energy accounting system. 

In 2009, a pseudonymous developer built this accounting system with computer code (as Bucky predicted would happen), and it has since been openly accessible to anyone worldwide. It is a public utility with increasing engagement, utility, and resiliency.
